title: Was Paul McCartney and Wings 1979 album “Back To The Egg” an album that was ahead of its time? - Quora

response.answer_text: I agree with Gary Spinelli, nothing really further to add… but I believe he was changing with the times more than being ahead with the punk rock movement… He also had two new members in Wings including Lawrence Juber who was a fabulous guitarist and still is! In hindsight, I believe the best on BTTE and London Town would have made a superb single album… Maybe using the Flux Capaciter we could suggest: Release “With A Little Luck” as just a single a few months before with “Spin It On” as a the flip side… "Reception"“Getting Closer” I still love this song! Catchy Pop! 79 Live version rocks!"We're Open Tonight""Again and Again and Again" (Denny Laine)“Name and Address”“I’ve Had Enough”“Arrow Through Me”Side two: “Daytime Nighttime Suffering“Don’t Let it Bring You Down”“Deliver You Children””Famous Groupies”“Rockestra Theme”""So Glad to See You Here""Baby's Request" –

Sure, to some degree. Arrow Through Me could’ve been a Stevie Wonder collaboration with the synths so it is a foreshadowing of their less, ahem, cooler duet, Ebony and Ivory. “Egg” was co-produced by Chris Thomas who had previously worked with Paul - and even more so, with George - on The White Album. Chris later went on to co-produce and win a Grammy with U2.
